item.content:encoded: Dimitris Koukoulopolous and I have just uploaded to the arXiv our paper ‚ÄúA note on the mean value of the Hooley delta function‚Äú. This paper concerns a (still somewhat poorly understood) basic arithmetic function in multiplicative number theory, namely the Hooley delta function where The function measures the extent to which the divisors of a [‚Ä¶]

item.content:encoded: Image: Frictional Games Did I lock the door? In his book Vimy Ridge, British journalist and military historian Alexander McKee described how deafening sounds could be registered as touch. ‚ÄúI felt that if I lifted a finger I should touch a solid ceiling of sound,‚Äù he wrote about experiencing a bombardment during the Battle of Vimy Ridge in 1917. item.title: Everything we know about Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Saber Interactive/Focus Entertainment Titus returns after more than 10 years Space Marine 2 looks like a straightforward game on the surface. The player takes up arms as Captain Titus, an Ult...
item.content:encoded: Image: Saber Interactive/Focus Entertainment Titus returns after more than 10 years Space Marine 2 looks like a straightforward game on the surface. The player takes up arms as Captain Titus, an Ultramarine serving the far future Imperium of Man. He‚Äôs the titular Space Marine, a transhuman soldier in power armor, and there‚Äôs an endless army of Tyranid swarms for him to kill. It‚Äôs the classic science fiction story of Man versus Bug. But if you dig into Space Marine 2‚Äôs setting of Warhammer 40,0...

item.title: Speed is all you need: On-device acceleration of large diffusion models via GPU-aware optimizations | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Juhyun Lee and Raman Sarokin, Software Engineers, Core Systems & Experiences The proliferation of large diffusion models for image generation has led to a significant increase in model s...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Juhyun Lee and Raman Sarokin, Software Engineers, Core Systems & Experiences The proliferation of large diffusion models for image generation has led to a significant increase in model size and inference workloads. On-device ML inference in mobile environments requires meticulous performance optimization and consideration of trade-offs due to resource constraints. Running inference of large diffusion models (LDMs) on-device, driven by the need for cost efficiency and user privacy, ...

item.title: Xbox and PlayStation disagree on the future of the forever game | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Asobo Studio/Xbox Game Studios Phil Spencer thinks Game Pass allows for a more relaxed approach. Is he right? Now that the dust has settled on Xbox‚Äôs and PlayStation‚Äôs big summer showcases, i...
item.content:encoded: Image: Asobo Studio/Xbox Game Studios Phil Spencer thinks Game Pass allows for a more relaxed approach. Is he right? Now that the dust has settled on Xbox‚Äôs and PlayStation‚Äôs big summer showcases, it‚Äôs a good time to compare them and look for evidence of where each company is heading ‚Äî or thinks it‚Äôs heading. As has increasingly been the case over the last few years, the two presentations were very different. Most observers feel that Xbox had the better show, in terms of the number and range o...

item.description: Posted by Junfeng He, Senior Research Scientist, and Kai Kohlhoff, Staff Research Scientist, Google Research People have the remarkable ability to take in a tremendous amount of information (estim...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Junfeng He, Senior Research Scientist, and Kai Kohlhoff, Staff Research Scientist, Google Research People have the remarkable ability to take in a tremendous amount of information (estimated to be ~1010 bits/s entering the retina) and selectively attend to a few task-relevant and interesting regions for further processing (e.g., memory, comprehension, action). Modeling human attention (the result of which is often called a saliency model) has therefore been of interest across the f...

item.title: Imagen Editor and EditBench: Advancing and evaluating text-guided image inpainting | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Su Wang and Ceslee Montgomery, Research Engineers, Google Research In the last few years, text-to-image generation research has seen an explosion of breakthroughs (notably, Imagen, Part...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Su Wang and Ceslee Montgomery, Research Engineers, Google Research In the last few years, text-to-image generation research has seen an explosion of breakthroughs (notably, Imagen, Parti, DALL-E 2, etc.) that have naturally permeated into related topics. In particular, text-guided image editing (TGIE) is a practical task that involves editing generated and photographed visuals rather than completely redoing them. Quick, automated, and controllable editing is a convenient solution ...

item.content:encoded: Clean Architecture You may have ever seen the picture above, or have ever heard/read about Clean architecture somewhere. It‚Äôs a very common concept in the software architecture design, there are already many writings about it out there on the internet. item.description: Based on reinforcement learning, our AI models AlphaZero and MuZero have achieved superhuman performance winning games. Now, they‚Äôre expanding their capabilities to help optimise resources in data cen...
item.content:encoded: Based on reinforcement learning, our AI models AlphaZero and MuZero have achieved superhuman performance winning games. Now, they‚Äôre expanding their capabilities to help optimise resources in data centres and advance video compression ‚Äì and most recently, our specialised version of AlphaZero, called AlphaDev, discovered new algorithms that are already accelerating the software applications at the foundations of our digital society.

item.content:encoded: Posted by Ruofei Du, Research Scientist, and Alex Olwal, Senior Staff Research Scientist, Google Augmented Reality Recent advances in video conferencing have significantly improved remote video communication through features like live captioning and noise cancellation. However, there are various situations where dynamic visual augmentation would be useful to better convey complex and nuanced information. For example, when discussing what to order at a Japanese restaurant, your friends could ...
